Posts.Title: Bleeding from Nipple EandAsmom EandAsmom

Posts.Content: EandAsmom wrote: Hi! This is my first post so I will give a bit of background. I am 50 years old. Two years ago began bleeding from my left nipple. Spontaneous bleeding, sometimes a lot. It took about a year to get diagnosed with a papilloma and I had it removed last summer. It was bliss to not be bleeding and even better to not worry about bleeding. Unfortunately it didn't last and I began bleeding again this December (6 months after single duct removal) from the exact same place. My surgeon was perplexed.. so I had a diagnostic mammogram..clear.. ultrasound.. confusing results because of previous surgery so I had an MRI which showed an 8mm enhancing mass right below my nipple..radiologist and surgeon believed it to be another papilloma (or adenoma). I had an excision last Friday and this time she removed all my ducts along with other abnormal tissue and sent it off. I am still waiting on pathology. I am not concerned that it is bc. The problem is that today I started bleeding from my nipple again! I am so confused. It is coming out of the same place in my nipple. She removed all my ducts. Where is the blood coming from? She had covered my nipple and areola with glue. For 4 days all was well. Yesterday , I could tell something had changed and it looked like there was bleeding under the glue. After my shower this morning, it's been bleeding. I am talking very little blood....like someone took a red sharpie and dabbed my gown several times....a spot the size of a dime in my bra....just like before my surgery. The blood isn't coming from the incision. The incision is on my areola and looks just fine. The blood is coming from a hole in my nipple like breast milk did. I know I need to call my bs. I live in OK and we have an ice storm so offices are closed and will be tomorrow too I'm sure. It isn't so bad of a bleed I need to reach her like there is an emergency. I am just so discouraged and confused. I have been searching these boards for any story like mine and I really haven't found any answers. I am hoping someone sees this and has some words of wisdom Log in to post a reply
